intro: Metrosideros operculata var. longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved Christmas bush, is a species of flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy red flowers that appear during the summer months. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically longer than those of the standard Metrosideros operculata. It thrives in coastal and maritime climates, often growing in dense shrubland or forest understorey. The variety is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its vibrant floral display.
